description: From Late Latin truncātiō, from Latin truncāre, past participle truncātus (“to cut off”). See truncate.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) The act of truncating or shortening (for example, words are shortened to form blend words or portmanteaus).
(mathematics) The removal of the least significant digits from a decimal number.
(geometry) The replacement of a solid angle by a plane, or a similar operation in other dimensions.
